text:
Food philosophy: “Consistency is very important when it comes to eating,” says the 35-year-old native of Brazil, who now lives in Miami. “I eat six meals a day and work out at least six days a week doing mostly boxing.”

Secret weapon: Every night, she downs a beverage made with buckwheat, which, despite the name, isn’t actually wheat. Rather, it’s a grain-like seed that’s gluten-free, packed with protein and, according to Lima, can help satisfy cravings for sweets and boost the metabolism.

“I’ll mix [buckwheat] with hemp milk and honey, and I’ll eat it hot or cold depending on how I feel,” she says. “Eating buckwheat before bedtime actually helps you burn calories while you sleep.”

Breakfast: A bowl of oatmeal

Midmorning snack: Piece of fruit

Lunch: Protein — typically chicken or fish — Japanese yams and quinoa

Afternoon snack: Raw almonds, raw cashews and dried cranberries

Early dinner: Protein — typically chicken or fish — Japanese yams and quinoa

Late-night snack: Buckwheat shake

What she does before the Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show: “I actually don’t change my workouts or diets,” says the mother of two, who adheres to a strict regimen year-round and has walked in 15 Victoria’s Secret shows previously.

Favorite splurge: “I have to have my cappuccino or latte every day, but I’ll [sweeten it with] honey instead of sugar,” she says. “I’m Brazilian, so I need that.”

The expert says: In theory, Lima’s buckwheat can help boost the metabolism all night long. “Because it is high-fiber, your body could continue to keep working on [digesting] it when you’re sleeping,” says Amy Shapiro, a registered dietitian and nutritionist based in Manhattan. “But mostly it’ll help with debloating.”
